physical_appearance:The book is hardcover and its front cover is predominantly yellow in colour. There is a picture of a stalk and a single flower
 a stream leading to an ocean
 and mountains that illustrate the front cover. There are no visible tears and the book does not look worn out. The front cover contains the title and the name of the author.

sgcool_label_text:The Real Malay (1900) is Sir Frank Swettenham\u0027s follow up to his earlier work
 Malay Sketches (1895). It contains his observations and perspectives on Malay life and culture. This is a presentation copy containing Swettenham\u0027s inscribed initials
 dated 29 January 1900.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: The Real Malay (1900) is Sir Frank Swettenham's follow up to his earlier work, Malay Sketches (1895). It contains his observations and perspectives on Malay life and culture. This is a presentation copy containing Swettenham's inscribed initials, dated 29 January 1900.
